security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill for documentation maintenance. Reads project files to verify documentation accuracy and suggests updates. No network calls, credential access, or code execution beyond file reads.

content.user_title: Maintain SnowTower documentation and README files
content.value_statement: Documentation drift happens when project changes are not reflected in README and docs. This skill audits documentation, verifies links and statistics, and ensures CLAUDE.md and project files stay synchronized with actual project state.
actual_capabilities: Audit README.md for accuracy and broken links
Verify CLAUDE.md matches actual project state
Review .claude folder contents and agent definitions
Check CI/CD badge URLs and workflow references
Sync documentation statistics with project counts
Validate internal documentation links resolve correctly
limitations: Does not modify files automatically (requires manual git operations)
Does not execute code or run external commands
Limited to single repository scope (no cross-repo documentation)
Cannot access private GitHub API for advanced link validation

use_cases.title: Pre-release documentation audit
use_cases.description: Verify all documentation is current before tagging a new release

use_cases.title: CI/CD badge validation
use_cases.description: Check that workflow badges and command references are accurate

use_cases.title: Onboarding documentation review
use_cases.description: Ensure docs accurately reflect current project structure

prompt_templates.title: Quick README check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if README.md is current by comparing the command references to pyproject.toml

prompt_templates.title: CLAUDE.md audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit the .claude folder and verify CLAUDE.md reflects actual agent and pattern definitions

prompt_templates.title: Link verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all broken links in docs/ and report which files need fixing

prompt_templates.title: Full documentation sync
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete documentation audit including README, CLAUDE.md, docs/, and .claude/ folder

output_examples.input: Check if README.md is current with the project state
output: - Version badges: 2 workflows have new names (ci.yml ‚Üí ci-pr.yml)
- Command references: All 8 commands verified in pyproject.toml
- Architecture diagram: Matches current snowddl/ structure
Action items: Update 2 badge URLs in README.md

best_practices: Run documentation audit after major features or before releases
Verify command references match actual scripts defined in pyproject.toml
Check CI/CD badges against actual workflow files in .github/workflows/
anti_patterns: Updating statistics without verifying actual file counts
Missing link verification after renaming files
Forgetting to update documentation when adding new scripts or commands

faq.question: What platforms is this skill compatible with?
faq.answer: Works with Claude Code, Claude Code CLI, and OpenAI Codex. Designed for Claude Code skill system.

faq.question: What file types can this skill audit?
faq.answer: Reads markdown files, YAML configs, Python project files, and shell scripts for verification.

faq.question: Does this skill modify files automatically?
faq.answer: No. This skill audits and reports issues. You must manually apply changes using git commands.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads files within the project. It does not access credentials, secrets, or external networks.

faq.question: Why does my documentation show incorrect statistics?
faq.answer: Run this skill to audit and identify drift. Update statistics manually after verifying actual counts.

faq.question: Can this skill work with other documentation tools?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on SnowTower project structure. Use with pre-commit hooks or CI validation for automated checks.
